712681f-a.text:
233 West 40th Street, (Repaired by owner).

President Borough of Manhattan.

712612f-a.text:
218-220 East 40th Street, south side, east of Third Ave. Shown is Fralsnings Armen, the 2nd Scandinavian corps of the Salvation Army.
October 9, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

712613f-a.text:
216 East 40th Street, south side, east of Third Ave. Shown is Fire
Engine Co. No. 21.
October 9, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

708065f-a.text:
Third Avenue, showing Tunnel Road north of East 40th Street.
P. L. Sperr  July 20, 1941

712637f-a.text:
The 440 Club was a popular downstairs watering hole for local office inhabitants. So named - 4 East 40th. After losing lease it became a restaurant which failed within a short time. Bldg will be demolished to make way for new (proposed) home of The Republic National Bank.
Earl Christian, photographer (NYPL)
Aug.1979

712639f-a.text:
W. 40th St. s.s. #6-18. Taken from NYPL Trustee's Room.
Earl Christian, NYPL photographer
Aug.1979
Neg B-72

1558204.title: 207-11 East 40th Street (Second Avenue - Third Avenue)
1558204.folder: 207-11 East 40th Street (Second Avenue - Third Avenue), Manhattan, NY

1507787-a.title: 40th Street (East) - Third Avenue, looking northwest
1507787-a.folder: 40th Street (East) - Third Avenue, looking northwest, Manhattan, NY

712614f-a.text:
East 40th Street, east from, but not including Third Ave., to the East River. Note a portion of the Tudor City Development in the background.
October 9, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

712677f-a.text: Received from Cross & Brown Co., March 1968.
